dublin_core.dcvalue: The eNut software provides an interactive mobile version of the government-approved treatment guidelines for acutely malnourished children for use by nurses and government health care workers. Data from past and current visits assess the child's progress and determine the next steps for effective treatment.
Nurse, clinics, Facility-based health workers, providers
Marc Mitchell, President, D-tree International, Email: mmitchel@hsph.harvard.edu | Patty Mechael, Executive Director, mHealth Alliance, Email: pmechael@mhealthalliance.org
Data collection and reporting, Electronic decision support, Electronic health records, Provider work planning and scheduling, Nutrition, Child Health
